title.narrative: OPT 2.1. POLICIES, STANDARDS AND M&E SYSTEM FOR QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: National and subnational institutions responsible for education, have improved capacity to design and implement policies and a monitoring system to support the quality of education with focus on inter-, intra- and multilingual education in at least two of the four departments receiving UNICEF support.

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

Bolivia Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Education)
UNICEF Programmes in Bolivia (Every Child Learns)

Bolivia 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and subnational institutions responsible for education, have improved capacity to design and implement policies and a monitoring system to support the quality of education with focus on inter-, intra- and multilingual education in at least two of the four departments receiving UNICEF support.

description.narrative: The central result was the advocacy work for improving the quality of education by generating evidence through learning evaluation processes, research and capacity building. While the Ministry of Education's learning achievement evaluation – supported by the Latin American Laboratory for the Evaluation of Educational Quality (LLECE) – was not carried out, progress was still made by strengthening capacities of the Plurinational Observatory of Educational Quality (OPCE) through the strenghting of institution building, conducting studies, thematic evaluations and the production of audiovisual material on 'educational qualities'. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: # of municipalities that receive support from UNICEF in developing quality standards for school infrastructure and interventions

target.value: 2022:8 municipalities: Cobija, Gonzalo Moreno, Cochabamba, Chimore, Puerto Villaroel, Independencia, La Paz, El Alto, Montero.

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Emergency response - Number of districts affected by civil strife, conflict, natural disaster or another emergency that have clear strategies for ensuring children's right to education
National educational standards regarding school infrastructure that include WASH standards with a gender-approach, developed and implemented with support from UNICEF

actual.value: 2020:National educational standards will be developed and implemented with support from UNICEF in 2020

title.narrative: Report on learning outcomes and educational quality published by the Ministry with support from UNICEF

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF supported the Ministry of Education in preparing the test for LLece. However, the activity was suspended in 2019 due to change of government and rescheduled by 2020.
